unnormalised: **Bollywood Bonanza: Box Office Brims with Biryani & Blockbusters!**

unnormalised: Mumbai: Bollywood's belt-tightening days seem over! This Diwali, the box office is bursting brighter than a Bhai Dooj diya, with a triple-header of releases vying for your hard-earned rupees.
normalised: mumbai bollywood's belt tightening days seem over this diwali the box office is bursting brighter than a bhai dooj diya with a triple header of releases vying for your hard earned rupees

unnormalised: First up, "Prem Ki Papad," a rom-com starring the ever-charming Varun Dhawan, promises more melodrama than a daily soap opera. Critics are calling it "sweet," "silly," and "something your aunties will definitely WhatsApp you about."
normalised: first up prem ki papad a rom com starring the ever charming varun dhawan promises more melodrama than a daily soap opera critics are calling it sweet silly and something your aunties will definitely whatsapp you about

unnormalised: Then there's "Dhoom Machale 5: Delhi Drift," where Abhishek Bachchan returns to chase bad guys doing impossible stunts on scooters â€“ because, obviously, Delhi traffic. We hear he jumps over 3 auto-rickshaws and drifts 50 km in the first scene.
normalised: then there's dhoom machale five delhi drift where abhishek bachchan returns to chase bad guys doing impossible stunts on scooters because obviously delhi traffic we hear he jumps over three auto rickshaws and drifts fifty kilometer in the first scene

unnormalised: Finally, for the serious cinephile, there's "Agni Pariksha 2.0," a gritty drama starring Naseeruddin Shah as a retired schoolteacher battling corruption in Varanasi. Expect heavy dialogue and even heavier emotions.
normalised: finally for the serious cinephile there's agni pariksha two point zero a gritty drama starring naseeruddin shah as a retired schoolteacher battling corruption in varanasi expect heavy dialogue and even heavier emotions

unnormalised: So, ditch the Onam sadhya for one night and head to your nearest cinema hall! Just remember to smuggle in your own popcorn; those cinema prices are a bigger scam than that plot twist in "Race 3."
